results.description:
Dear friends,

Last Sunday's Chatty Concert at Caffe Vivaldi was truly magical. 

A new Classical for All follower said she feels like she just took a crash course in classical music, she learned so much while enjoying the music and the atmosphere. "You don't feel "left out", which happens sometimes in classical music concerts, you start thinking this isn't something I would understand, but here it was the opposite. I'll bring my friends every Sunday!" 

Join us this week for an amazing time!


UPCOMING DATES:

Sunday December 20, 27, Jan. 3, 10, 17 4​:00 ​pm

Caffe Vivaldi; 32 Jones Street NYC

"Chatty Pianist" Emir GAMSIZOGLU; www.emirgamsiz.com

Program; Bach, Chopin, Tchaikovsky, Beethoven, Mozart, Schubert, Levitzky and Gershwin. (Check out individual meetups for program updates)

results.description:
Here's my next pick in our indie film series: http://www.ifccenter.com/films/45-years/

Screen legends Charlotte Rampling and Tom Courtenay star in Haigh’s (Weekend, HBO’s Looking) moving and profound look at marriage and the secrets we keep. Kate Mercer is deep in preparations for her 45th wedding anniversary. All is going as planned, until a letter arrives for her husband (Courtenay). The body of his first love, vanished in a hiking accident a half-century earlier, has been discovered, frozen and preserved in the glaciers of the Alps—calling everything Kate thought she knew about her marriage into question.

Winner, Best Actress (Charlotte Rampling), Los Angeles Film Critics Association

Meetup Details:
We will be attending the 5pm showtime. I will be standing in front of the theater @ 4:30pm, and will walk in @ 4:45pm. If we get separated, we can regroup outside after the film. A coffee or wine venue will be chosen nearby for post-film discussion. I'll message confirmed members my phone number on the morning of the meetup.

See you there!

results.description:
Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 5PM to 5:30PM, then we begin the show at 5:30 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 8PM.


This week we have Season 3:


Episode 3 "</a><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walk_of_Punishment">Walk of Punishment"

Episode 4 "And Now His Watch Is Ended"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again. Newbies sit back and listen as GOT scholars discuss the shows in comparison to the books.


You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer and/or other drinks). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Wendys and a Smashburger and $1 Pizza on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too).

5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

results.description:
New Year's Dinner && Gift Exchange (must RSVP - updated pls read)

Please RSVP as early as possible, but no later than 3PM that Sunday.

NOTE:  it is important for the people who already RSVP'd, that you re-confirm your RSVP with either a PM to me or a public comment stating your reconfirmation...  ;-)

White Elephant will be the method of the exchange, with the following rules:

• Each participant supplies one wrapped gift. 

• The gifts are placed in a central location, and participants will draw a card to determine order.  Cards will be ranked Ace (high) to Two (low), then by suit (Spades > Hearts > Clubs > Diamonds) with the lowest overall ranking going first (2 of Diamonds) & the person closest to the Ace of Spades last.

• The first person opens a wrapped gift, and the turn ends. 

• On subsequent turns, each person can open a new present or gets the choice to "steal" another person's gift. The gift cannot be stolen once the third participant touches the gift (i.e. - it is stolen for the 2nd time). 

• When a person's gift is stolen, that person can either choose another wrapped gift to open or can steal from another player. 

• The game is over when the last person goes and after first person goes a second time

• Chris suggested a $25 maximum to the gifts so no one goes overboard, and to that, I'm going to add to that a $15 minimum.
results.name: New Year's Dinner && Gift Exchange (must RSVP - updated pls read)

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
SWINGIN' SUNDAYS - WEST COAST SWING LESSONS AND DANCE

every 1st, 3rd, & 5th Sunday

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

BEGINNER AND INTERMEDIATE LESSONS: 6:00-6:45 PM

from 9/7-12/7, the intermediate lesson will be a performance class, see details below

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

-BEGINNERS WELCOME! We have a Basic lesson to start the night and some fantastic local instructors on hand to guide you, so tell ALL your friends!

-Featuring a wonderful mix of rotating DJs.

-Low cost, high fun at a nice venue

-Only $7 before 5:15 PM for more than 4 hours of dancing fun :-)

-2 Lessons: Basic & Intermediate at 6:00 PM

-Dance Party starts at 6:45 PM and goes 'till 12:00 AM

-$7 before 5:15 PM, $12 after

***************************************************************

------IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT------From 9/7/14-12/7/14-----

In place of the intermediate class, we'll be offering an intermediate level routine and performance opportunity.

We will be teaching and cleaning the routine on 9/7, 9/21, 10/5, 10/19, 11/2, 11/16, 11/30

You will perform in the show on Sunday, December 7th.

There is NO CHARGE for the class!

All you need to do is pay for the admission to the dance and show up by 6:00 PM!

What YOU get out of this:

1) The opportunity to perform for a group of supportive dancers

2) The opportunity to learn, practice, and utilize skills that help you understand musicality, presentation, partnering, and phrasing.

3) A TON OF FUN

What We Need From YOU:

1) Just YOU - partner NOT required

2) The choreography will be taught over the first 5 sessions. You need to be in attendance at least 3 of the first 5 Sundays. You also need to attend the review sessions on the last two Sundays (11/16 & 11/30). So in total, of the 7 choreography sessions, you need to attend at least 5.

***************************************************************

All night drinks specials!

* $6 Sangria

* $16 1/2 Carafe of Sangria

* $5 Corona

* $2 Bottle of Water

LOCATION:

Dancesport

22 West 34th St, btw 5 & 6 Av

4th floor

Look forward to seeing you there!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pssssst: This dance is part of a collaboration of multiple dance styles using the same venue to offer different dance styles all at the same time. There's Bachata, Salsa, Zouk, Kizomba, and West Coast Swing all happening at the SAME place, at the SAME time, for the SAME price! So, you have the chance to check out FIVE different dances all for the price of 1!  The evening starts with a Bachata Lesson at 5:00 PM.  For More Information:  https://www.facebook.com/events/308507872585674/

Rain or Shine:  For those who missed the previous feast or want to do this again, join us and experience a Filipino Kamayan Night at Ugly Kitchen. You will enjoy some yummy Filipino food via eating with your hands.  I will show you how to portion out your food and eat with your hands without using plates, spoons, forks and or knives.  Hand wipes will be provided. We will take all steps necessary to have a yummy, healthy and clean dinner.  If you are super sensitive about germs, this event is not for you.

3. RSVP changes within 48 hours of the event will be treated as a NO SHOW.  See NO SHOW policy in the "About us..." section. 

4. CASH only.

5. $30 per person (including tax and tip)

Fried Tilapia

Crab

Shrimp

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games!"... 

Please RSVP...  Please RSVP...  Please RSVP...  Please RSVP...  Please RSVP...  

1st of the New Year, 2016, @ The Olive Garden

Location, Location!...  Panera is having a Manager's meeting on this date; and so we won't be able to game there as normal, but luckily Monique Brager the manager at the Olive Garden has agreed today (Thursday) to accommodate us!

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Citron is a French Bistro.  Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Citron

results.description:
TRANSFORMATIONAL POETRY and Short Stories - Sunday at 7 pm


“The birds have vanished into the sky,

  and the last clouds  have drained away.

 We sit together, the Mountain and me,

 Until only the Mountain remains.”  Li Po  701_762 AD  (Chinese Poet)

We will read and discuss various Transformational Poems that Resonate and bring us to “Wonder, Mystery and Oneness”.  Among the poets we will explore are: Mary Oliver, Rumi, Ryokan, Li Po, Rilke, Basho, Antonia Machado, Hafiz, Lao Tzu, Chuang Tzu and many others. 

No previous experience is necessary.  If you have favorite poems, please bring their work with you to share. You could even bring your own poem, the more poems we have, the richer the experience will be.


TIMES 7:00 to 8:30 pm starting Sunday Dec 20th until Jan 17th. You can come to any session, they are not consecutive. We will start at 7:00 pm sharp, so please come at least by 6:45.

PLACE: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Avenue.

BRING:  Please bring PAPER and PENCIL

FREE: A small donation ($1 to $5) would be appreciated for the Room rental and Clean-Up
results.how_to_find_us: Street Floor - "Ware" Room on right
results.name: TRANSFORMATIONAL POETRY - Swimming in Beauty

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Nov 15, 2015-Jan 10, 2016
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:
November 29
December 20
December 27
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633176138</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125383<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.
results.name: Indoor gym soccer-Fleetwood

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
The Inner Confidence Overview:

If your long term goal is to find a quality woman, you have to first have success with a lot of women and understand the dating game. You can’t luck your way into an amazing relationship just like you can’t luck your way into an Ivy League University.

Are you willing to put in the effort and become successful with women, a leader of men and a boss in social situations? If so, you’ve come to the right place.

Here is the path to success with women:

Step 1 is everything that happens before you open your mouth.

Most guys think that they look presentable, but truth be told, most guys are clueless of how to present themselves to women. If you don't dress and present the body language of someone she would date, you've got no chance and she'll immediately rule you out.

We walk around making snap judgements of people all the time.  You’re sitting in a restaurant scanning the room thinking “There’s an old waitress, fat chick, cute hostess with a nice little tush, sloppy looking dude, short, broke bus boy, rich old guy, etc…”

You’re not the only one doing the judging, they are judging you too.

Women have a forcefield that protects them from ineligible suitors and the number one factor the forcefield discriminates against is your appearance.

You don't have to be good looking, but you must look good.

If your body language is confident and you know how to dress, you can fake the funk enough to get past the forcefield of most beautiful women.

But if your fashion sucks and its obvious that you don’t quite fit in, you’ll never even get your foot in the door.

Step 2 is what we call Social Protocol.

Social protocol is the established code of procedure or behavior in any group, organization, or social situation.  If you do not follow social protocol, you will trigger the second layer of someone’s forcefield.

Your appearance will get you in the door, but the wrong behavior will get you booted right back out.

Having a mastery of social protocol is something that can take years, even decades to accomplish.  If you want an example look at successful politicians.  Successful politicians rarely slip up in social situations and they have the ability to make everyone they meet feel important and like their best friend.  They are dynamic, interesting, engaging and attentive. In order for a politician to be successful he/she must win over the majority of people to keep their job.

Politics isn’t for everyone but in order to attract the right people into your life, you have to understand the level of social protocol in order to fit in.  Social protocol is made up of many factors: How you engage people, how you say hello, goodbye, where you sit at a table, how you shake someone’s hand, where you wait outside of a club, when you ask a woman for a phone number, when you go for a kiss, how to introduce your friends to each other, how you order a drink, how you split a tab, the list goes on and on and on.  There is even a recognizable vernacular for different groups of people.

If you want to follow "cool people" social protocol, you have to learn the "cool people" vernacular.  If you want to fit in with a bunch of techie geeks, you have to talk like a techie geek.

If you still believe there is a quick fix for a guy who doesn’t understand social protocol I hope you can see the flaw in your logic.  You cannot have a mastery of social protocol over night because you must learn the rules which takes time and exposure.

The key to really being a master at any skill is to understand the rules so well that you know how to break them.

Step 3 is to learn to not give a shit and you'll embody "cool."

Cool is defined as this: marked by steady dispassionate calmness and self-control.  In other words, someone who doesn't give a shit and knows when and when not to get excited.  When you learn social protocol and interact with hundreds and hundreds of people in social situations the anxiety and nervousness you once felt will fade away.

You will no longer fear rejection and thriving in social situations will become second nature to you...

The key to really being a master at any skill is to understand the rules so well that you know how to break them.

We will go much further in depth into these topics during the meetup and you'll walk away with a roadmap of how to become a man who is loved by women and envied by other men.
results.name: 3 Strategies To Meet Women, Bypass Their "Forcefields" & Get In The Money Zone

10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN

30- Day ONLINE Coaching Program to help you break through to your best year EVER!

This January, join this group coaching program with Createthrough Coach Dee Savoy consists of 3 10-day spirals focusing on mastering the three most important aspects of your new year:

Your PURPOSE -- What is 2016 about for you?
Your PRIORITIES -- What do you need to do and in what order?
Your PLAN -- What do you need to do (and when)?

We rise to great heights by a winding staircase of small steps. — Francis Bacon

Take this first step in rising to new heights in the next year. What you will get during the 30-Day Intensive Program:

--Individual ignition session with Createthrough Coach Dee Savoy
--Meditations and affirmations for each of the three cycles
LIVE telecall at the beginning of each cycle
--Downloadable Art and Writing Journal to be used during the 30 days
--Facebook group for interaction, support and networking
--Everyone leaves with an ACTION PLAN for jumpstarting 2016

• To register, CLICK HERE.

Although this program functions on a very pragmatic level, I always believe in dealing with issues on all levels--physical, emotional, mental and spiritual. Each of these aspect will be addressed as part of my holistic approach to coaching. This is why meditation, affirmations, creative art and writing journaling and healing sessions are an integral part of our work together. Here's our schedule--

⇒ Spiral 1: January 4-- Discovering Your Mission for 2016
⇒ Spiral 2: January 14- Setting goals and devising strategies
⇒ Spiral 3: January 24- Womanifesting what you want

For a limited time, only, this entire program, including 3 bonuses is available for only $25.

(The price goes up to $47. December 1!)

As if that were not enough of a sweet deal, here's three bonuses open to all participants in the program:

BONUS 1:

21-days of journaling prompts (Value=$49.) These prompts are from my Creativity program and they are designed to tap into your creative potential. You can use these in conjunction with your art/writing journal or work on them separately.

BONUS 2:

FREE Butterfly Breakout Session (Value=$150.) This is the first session I give my one-on-one clients to help them discover which aspects of their lives and energy fields need the most attention.

BONUS 3:

FREE Group Healing Session (Value =$90.) to boost energy and strength for transformation. This session will be held in Bronx, NY as a special nod to my hometown. Date and time of this session is TBD and may be webcast.

TO REGISTER:  CLICK HERE


Everything you want is just outside your comfort zone. — R. Allen 

ASK YOURSELF THIS --

Isn't it time you took charge of your life and started moving in the direction of your dreams? We all are co-creators of our existence, by helping to call in those things we desire and letting go of past pain, guilt, sadness, shame or other emotions that keep us stuck and unfulfilled. Isn't it time you took a chance on yourself and the life outside your comfort zone that is calling to you? I know that striving for your dreams rather than settling for the status quo can be risky, but is it really any more dangerous than never truly going for it?

I'll try to take some of the risk out of it for you by offering you this guarantee--

TRY THE COURSE FOR 1 SPIRAL. IF YOU ARE NOT SATISFIED I WILL REFUND YOUR ENTIRE FEE!

Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.

Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. His company uses a strategy of joining, leveraging or building opportunities for its clients. These opportunities increase conversion through introductions that are highly targeted and increase revenue. Introductions of prospects and referral businesses give Know My Business effective ways in which to build relationships through trust. These techniques are openly shared for others to replicate.

In association with a wide range of business networks, across numerous markets, Hardeep has developed relationships with many businesses. Since founding the business in 2012, Hardeep has become a leader in his field and regularly referenced in conversation, the strongest form of communication.

MEETUPS in 2016

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia
results.name: French Monday's @ Cellar Bar

results.description:
Come join Bi+ and Bi-friendly people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic-oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.


2016 Scheduling Change:  Starting in January 2016, we're adjusting our discussion meetings to accommodate our late shift workers and evening class students.. Hopefully if you have class on (the first) Monday, you can make it on (the third) Thursday of any given month.    

About us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest continues the work of hosting biweekly discussions and monthly social gatherings serving the New York City metropolitan area; we've been rocking our bi selves since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals of ever stripe (bi, fluid, queer, pan, omni, sapio, and so many more).  And we welcome bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st Monday and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion.  We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description: I always learn something new at the group, like an advanced feature, or a glitch/bug to beware of. The Microsoft Conference Center, is free of charge, at 41st Street and 8th Avenue, (NorthEast corner... i.e. not in Port Authority). Ignore the note on this page, which says, "Max: 1 person". We never max out room capacity. The reason it says it's maxed out, is because I can't sign you up through meetup.com. To RSVP, please send an email to: LindaEwen at nyc dot rr dot com, with your first and last name. We plan on meeting on the 1st Monday of every month, but occasionally there are changes. You should receive an email, if there's a change. I suggest you print out any email response you receive, even though it's not required. The Conference Center's security department, requires your first and last name, so please include your full name, within the body of your email. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. If you don't get an email back from anyone, within a day or two, please send a 2nd request.It's OK, to be half an hour early and use the free coffee machine. Try to go early, if it's your first time, in case you are not registered properly. If you arrive, and the the security personnel informs you of a registration problem, don't be alarmed, they will assist you. Please be patient, (no seating limitation). For those who sent their first email request, on the day of the event, this process may take half an hour, and the cut off time for confirmation is 7:00 PM. If you would like to use meetup to remind yourself, find the duplicate listing of this event at http://www.meetup.com/Spreadsheets/events/calendar/

results.description:
Hey friends over 40!!!  Let's get together and meet each other.  If you can come at 630 or 7 that's great too.  Just let me know!

Meeting new friends is FUN.  This bar/restaurant is  JUST ACROSS from Penn Station.  Every train is nearby so no excuses regarding transportation.

Let's keep the holiday spirit rolling along with this Monday after work gathering in 2016.  I'll share my New Year's resolution, and maybe you will too!

Stay for 30 minutes, or 3 hours.  JUST COME ON OUT!  I need 5 people or more for this meet up.  Please don't let me down(smile).
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bar area by the front windows!

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

FOR TWO HOURS, ONE SANDWICH AT A TIME, HELP OP.LYNX LESSEN THE BURDEN OF HOMELESSNESS FOR LGBT YOUTH SERVED BY SYLVIA’S PLACE.

On Monday, January 4, Out Professionals invites you to join public-spirited Members and friends of OP.LYNX, our dynamic women's network, in a two-hour sandwich-making effort.

Under the guidance of One Sandwich at a Time, volunteers will create hundreds of nutritious sandwiches for those served by MCCNY Homeless Youth Services, whose Sylvia’s Place remains one of the city’s only shelters to accept youth directly off the street, without a referral. As a result, it has become a refuge for the underserved — transgender youth and those experiencing trauma or living with HIV/AIDS. 

Founded by Erin Dinan, One Sandwich at a Time has been awarded U.N. recognition for its impact.

results.description:
We meet every Monday from 6-7:30 pm to share, shed shame, end the inner wars of emotional eating and support weight loss and weight maintenance efforts.

It is believed that being part of a circle with others who understand the inner and outer struggles with food and weight is healing, increases self esteem, self image, courage and strength to make healthy changes.

This group has been in existence for four plus years. Some are committed to attending once a week. Others come twice per month... Two Monday's per month are for everyone/open enrollment. The other two Monday's are preserved for the closed group members who come very week.

PRE - REGISTRATION IS REQUIRED.

Please Email or call Carol:  [masked][masked]
FEE: $20.00; Fee is waived with eligible insurance.


I am a Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Private Practice and have been a therapist for twenty five years. When requested by the group I prepare topics. In addition to facilitating the meetings I sometimes offer handouts/reading material. I have my own history with emotional eating and weight struggles and love teaching and guiding the group with techniques that have worked, continue to work, for me.

Typically 6-10 members attend each meeting - meetup is not the only way to sign up.

I hope you will join us! Looking forward to meeting you

Carol

results.description:
This meetup is about coming together to hear what we all are working on, pitching new ideas, discussing our needs to begin and finish projects, and helping to make it happen.  Please be sure to answer the RSVP questions fully to help ensure this meetup is successful.


During our time together, there will be an allocated time where each member gets an opportunity to introduce him/herself and their experience level. Those who are ready to launch projects/or are looking for writing collaborators will have three minutes to pitch her/his idea to the room, with (if needed) an extra minute to mention above and below the line needs in terms of crew, locations, extras, support, phone calls, whatever. Following the pitches, we will then break into an informal session of conversation, where we can talk among ourselves about the pitches and our experience, offer advice, get to know one another, form crews, etc.


We firmly believe that you don't need money to make films, and creative projects, all you really need is friends.


Let's do it.

NOTE: The meetup fee is simply to cover the cost of the venue.

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Joumor FUNdamentals:

In order function optimally, your subconscious must be cleared of things nagging at and distracting you. Learn how to apply the Joumor principles and methodology to organize your environment to put you at your best.

This 4 week class will teach you all you need to know to get started organizing any project or area, and improving your productivity and efficiency. You will learn how to identify what works best for you and implement it.

BONUS: You will ALSO receive a half hour private coaching session with Leah Fisch, founder of Joumor, one week following the class to focus exactly on your needs.

Week 1:

You will also articulate 1 goal to achieve during the 4 weeks of class and your personal manifesto. Once you have done this, it will be easy and automatic to align with your values and increase productivity.

Week 2:

Now that your environment is taking shape to better support your goal, you are in a position to assess what works best for you. You will continue organizing and closing open "energy drains" as well as begin to take a deeper look at the categories and systems you have created.

Week 3:

What's working, what's not working, and whatever works! We will break down your project into manageable and fun pieces, and your remaining work to complete your goal by the end of class will be mapped out clearly.

Week 4:

You will have a chance to present your achievements to the class and explain your own particular style that you have articulated. In educating yourself you will be in a position to educate others on ideas and systems that work, as well as how to support you in your projects. Whatever remains, if anything, of your goal to be completed, will be mapped out and scheduled.

Week 5:

BONUS! Your private half hour phone session with Leah will give you a chance to work live in your environment and receive any support, coaching, or ideas that you need from your goal project or for others that have surfaced during the month.

Sign up HERE.
results.name: Joumor's FUNdamentals of Organizing & Productivity

results.description:
You are invited to join us for a data science study session. On Monday, January 4, Matt Monihan from RJMetrics, will present his lessons-learned on data-driven storytelling and building modern reporting products.

Summary: One of the most important, yet often neglected areas of data-driven decision-making is design. With such great insights being generated, it’s truly a shame if they go unheard or misunderstood. In this talk, Matt will discuss the pitfalls of communicating data in a large organization, the best ways to tell a compelling story with data, and the elements of the BI stack that will help you do it. With references to industry giants like Edward Tufte, Stephen Few, and Bret Victor, you can expect to learn how new and old ideas are driving modern storytelling.

Speaker Biography: Matt Monihan is on the product team at RJMetrics, a business intelligence company in Philadelphia. With some exceptionally intelligent people at RJ, he designed one of the world's most advanced chart builders. Prior to RJMetrics, Matt graduated from Drexel University and briefly ran small app development studio, Jarv.us.

Before you attend, here is a preparation checklist: 

1. Sign up for a github account. This will allow us to more easily share code and collaborate together. (https://github.com/)

2. Make sure you can log in to our chat room with your github account. This is the place to ask questions. (https://gitter.im/NYDSSG/chat)

3. Join our google mailing list. This will allow you to access and contribute to the tutorial list that the group is working on. More importantly, this lets you team up with other students on tutorials that are interesting to you.

Our goal is to create a friendly and productive environment where we can build skills together with fellow data scientists. It doesn't matter if you use Python, R, or Excel, have 2 years of experience or 2 days, everyone is welcome to join. But to make it worth your time, check out the tutorial list FIRST. Pair up in a group if you see something interesting. Otherwise, add a tutorial so that others can join you. It's more fun to learn together.

Many thanks to our sponsor, Tumblr, who is graciously lending us their space.

We look forward to seeing you on Monday!

Here is our current tutorial list.
results.name: Data Science Study Session @Tumblr

results.description:
-posted by Jennifer G.-

Join us for dinner at Whole Foods Market in Jericho. What a great way to start off the year!

This VLI gathering is a casual event. Show up at 6:30, or later than that. It's fine to drop in when you can. The store closes at 10.


The food bar is vegan-friendly (vegan items are clearly labeled, ingredients are listed).  You pay by the weight of your food. (A typical total is $10-11.) Please fill your bowl with vegan fare and skip the non-vegan stuff, in keeping with VLI event guidelines. Thank you!

(At VLI meetups, the food is always vegan, and everyone is treated with kindness. In other words, we expect everyone to enjoy a vegan meal together, even if you or your guests don't think of yourselves as vegan yet.)

Want to go greener? Whole Foods offers durable bowls, but not durable utensils. So you might bring utensils for yourself. You could bring your own water bottle, too.

RSVPs: even though this gathering is more casual than other restaurant outings, we still ask that you keep your RSVP up-to-date. That way, we know whom to expect & how many seats to save. Thanks!  


Hope to see you!

Description:

from Goodreads.com
Written at the height of his powers immediately after Brave New World, Aldous Huxley's highly acclaimed Eyeless in Gaza is his most personal novel. Huxley's bold, nontraditional narrative tells the loosely autobiographical story of Anthony Beavis, a cynical libertine Oxford graduate who comes of age in the vacuum left by World War I. Unfulfilled by his life, loves, and adventures, Anthony is persuaded by a charismatic friend to become a Marxist and take up arms with Mexican revolutionaries. But when their disastrous embrace of violence nearly kills them, Anthony is left shattered—and is forced to find an alternative to the moral disillusionment of the modern world.

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
This is an open invitation for those who might be interested in learning more about Grandmother Ceremonies in the Colombian tradition being practiced in the NY area. This information session encompasses the understanding of this tradition, protocols, preparations and risks, why is it used back in the jungle and why is coming out of this sacred space into our cities.

Taita Fredy grew up around the medicine, he comes from Mallama, Nariño, a región south west of Colombia, between the Pacific and the Amazon jungle in this area he’s experienced the medicine in different traditions, learning as an apprentice and helper for Elders from the Siona, Inga, Kamentzá, Yanacona and Awá communities, For the last 15 years he’s been working with the medicine himself and developing his own ceremony based on all he’s learned. In the present Fredy has found himself traveling around the world, sharing his ceremony, his medicine and his heart with people from different cultures and backgrounds, this as he believes, is part of his mission in this life to take this knowledge and healing to those who need it.

Fredy is a humble man who doesn’t believe in one only truth, he keeps his heart open to all believes, and bases his work in the concepts of love and freedom. There is no obligation, no dependence, and no commitment to a group or believe, just respect.

During the two-hour sessions, Fredy will share not only information but also his gift as a sound healer, interpreting melodies that he uses to guide the Singing Meditation Ceremonies.
results.name: Free Ancestral Journey Information Session

results.description:
Beyond Faith is a support group for young people under 30 who are currently, or have in the past, gone through the often difficult process of leaving Christianity. Beyond Faith is for the person who doesn't quite fit in with the pack, a person whose ideals and beliefs do not jive with their peers, family members, or loved ones. This can be a tough journey, especially for those whose family and friends are unsupportive of their doubts and lack of belief. Our group aims to create a safe space of support, community, inclusiveness, and encouragement on this journey away from Christianity and towards a reason-based worldview. For some, just the idea of entertaining serious doubts about faith can be dangerous and overwhelming, and Beyond Faith seeks to ease the process and create a warm, welcoming and optimistic environment for like-minded folks on the same path.


Beyond Faith is open to any young people who identify as atheist, agnostic, Humanist, or who are having doubts about Christianity. We are open to any and all denominations of Christianity. Beyond Faith is a safe space for women, people of color, LGBTQ people, and those who are differently-abled. Because of this, the facilitators and participants of this group will be expected to keep member identities, meeting locations, and content confidential to protect everyone involved.

In order to ensure the confidentiality and safety of our group members, please email [masked] with the following questionnaire for the location details.


New Member Questionnaire:
In an effort to ensure all members of this group are respectful and open to others, we ask that you fill out this short questionnaire so the organizers can tailor the group to its members. We have a zero-tolerance policy for evangelism at our meetings; people attending for the sake of evangelizing will be asked to leave. We do this in an effort to protect our members and ensure that our group is a safe space for all attendees.

This is NOT an application, all serious members will be invited regardless of answers to the questions below.

1. Why are you interested in Beyond Faith?

2. Can you tell us a little about yourself (including name/age/where you're from), and how your experiences have brought you the point you're at now? [You only need to share as much as you are comfortable with]

3. Do you define yourself as any/all of the following: atheist, agnostic, humanist, nontheist, or any other term?

4. Where would you consider yourself on your journey out of Christianity and into atheism/agnosticism/nontheism/etc?

 

Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. You are welcome and encouraged to bring friends and family members that you think may benefit from this group as well. We look forward to having you!

 

As there is limited space, we ask that you only attend if you are under the age of 30. If, however, you are older than 30 and are very interested in attending, or have attended our discussions in the past, please send us a private message and we may be able to work something out.
results.name: Beyond Faith: An Ex-Christian Student Support Group

Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

Always wanted to take a tango class, but don’t have the time for regular lessons? Ready to dive in to the elegance and passion of one of the world’s oldest dances? No partner needed, no tango experience required. Leather soled shoes are required.

Registration link is here!

This mini-course will teach you how to read market structure. Understanding market structure allows you to anticipate coming price action. You will learn to identify and analyze accumulation, distribution, re-accumulation and re-distribution – the key trading ranges that power trends. You will also learn Wyckoff trade set-ups based on market structure, how to enter an existing trend, and how to recognize in advance when a trend is likely to end. •Why analysis of market structure should precede everything else

•Price behavior signaling a change of trend and/or beginning of consolidation

•The Price Cycle: Accumulation, Mark-Up, Distribution and Mark-Down

•Trading ranges that generate big trends: accumulation and distribution

•A key concept in Wyckoff Method analysis of trading ranges: Phases

•Phase anatomy: Wyckoff Method events (e.g., climaxes, tests, springs, upthrusts, signs of strength)

•Identifying phases in accumulation and distribution

•How to enter a position in an established trend

•Distinguishing re-accumulation from distribution and re-distribution from accumulation

•Three rules to trade Wyckoffian market structures

•Exercises and home assignments

Course Duration: 4 online sessions

Dates: January 4, 11, 18 and 25

Time: 7:00-9:00 p.m. EST

Regular Cost: $400 for new students

SPECIAL PROMOTION: $300 for new students (only for the month of January). This offer expires on December 3rd.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 4,000 words or 15 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 4 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
December's book is Tender is the Night by F. Scott Fitzgerald: 

Set on the French Riviera in the late 1920s, Tender Is the Night is the tragic romance of the young actress Rosemary Hoyt and the stylish American couple Dick and Nicole Diver. A brilliant young psychiatrist at the time of his marriage, Dick is both husband and doctor to Nicole, whose wealth goads him into a lifestyle not his own, and whose growing strength highlights Dick's harrowing demise.

I thought I'd give us a little extra reading time for this month, what with the holidays and everything; the 28th seemed a little inconvenient, especially for those who are traveling. That may give us slightly less time with January's book, but it's a fairly short one. :)

Friendly reminder that there is a fee of $2 for each meeting collected upon arrival! (Should've put that in last month's description; sorry about that.)

Monday night's lecture will be a continuation of the "Left Hand Path" theme. I will be covering the ancient technology of the Atlantean's including the Vril of the Mahabharata, Keeley's motor, mantric (sound) technology and the pyramid generators. We will also discuss the rediscovery of much of this technology by the Nazi's during WWII and bring it all into the present with the battle of "Open Source Everything" vs top down oligarch controlled statism.

"It is from the Fourth Race that the early Aryans got their knowledge of “the bundle of wonderful things,” the Sabha and Mayasabha, mentioned in the Mahabharata, the gift of Mayasur to the Pandavas. It is from them that they learnt aeronautics, Viwan Vidya (the “knowledge of flying in air-vehicles”), and, therefore, their great arts of meteorography and meteorology. It is from them, again, that the Aryans inherited their most valuable science of the hidden virtues of precious and other stones, of chemistry, or rather alchemy, of mineralogy, geology, physics and astronomy." - SD Vol II p. 426

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7:30 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

 
Nov 9:  Experienced Circlers Only
Nov 16  :  Beginners 6:30,  Experienced Circlers 7:30
November 22:   Experienced Circlers Only
November 29 : Be sure to join us for the large Community Circling Night where our community comes together for a robust night of circling with multiple facilitators and amazing group presence exercises. These nights include intro for newcomers. Register here: https://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

Discussion often incorporates, naturally, other issues we face when working on longer pieces.

We will continue to schedule Monday evening write! regardless of attendance, but will cancel if less than three writers have RSVP'd. results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

Every Monday & Wednesday Nights at 8pm. (Rsvp required)

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
