results.description:
I was wondering if after all these years you'd like to meetup.com...

QueensJS is celebrating the brand new year with our 18th meetup on Wednesday, January 6th, at our usual haunt, Raven’s Head Pub in Astoria on 38th & Broadway, just around the corner from the Steinway MR stop and 7 short streets over from the Broadway NQ stop.


Your speakers for the evening are:

• Artur Paikin (@arturi) encourages us to "Divide and Conquer Your House: Building a home automation robot with Arduino, Raspberry Pi and Node.js"


• Suz Hinton (@noopkat) helps us with "Manual Testing: Just add dopamine"


• Nick Hehr (@hipsterbrown) curls his mustache with "Talking Tessel from a Hardware Newbie"


QueensJS expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf code of conduct.


RSVPs, due to limited seating, will cost $5. All proceeds go towards charities that work to increase code literacy among NYC youth. There are no refunds, but you are more than welcome to transfer tickets.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at organizers at queensjs dot com!

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Join us January 6 when Robin Hanson previews The Age of Em. His upcoming book and research unveil a world run by robots. Not a science fiction novel, he envisions every aspect of our lives influenced by the spread of robots from the workplace and life extension to personal relationships. His insights on employment challenges are especially noteworthy. Robin will devote extra time for Q&A, due to the subject’s depth and his varied interests (as below). Doors open at 6:30pm. 

About Robin in his words:


I am interested in all aspects of the future, including uploading, nanotech,  hypertext publishing, cosmology and the foundations of physics, future economic growth rates, limits of computation, and the origin of life. I'd love to specialize in the economics of science fiction. Some fun places to discuss such issues are the Polymath and the Extropians mailing list which I have participated in since 1991. (I especially enjoy posts by Hal Finney.) I don't sign onto "Extropianism" though; I don't sign onto any "ism". I am, however, a Alcor <a>cryonics</a> customer. For a few hundred dollars a year, I estimate I'm buying a >5% chance of living for thousands of (subjective) years. 

Pre-Order The Book:  http://www.amazon.com/The-Age-Em-Robots-Earth/dp/0198754620

Speaking Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qcIsjrHENU

About Robin Hanson:  http://mason.gmu.edu/~rhanson/home.html#AboutMe

Blog: 

Overcoming Bias  



Web Coverage:

http://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2015/09/robin-hansons-new-book.html

http://www.overcomingbias.com/2015/03/oxford-to-publish-the-age-of-em.html

http://anglejournal.com/article/2015-06-brain-emulation-economies-the-next-stage-of-human-development/

RSVP Here. 

Admission is $5.50 online, $7 cash at door. Light snacks and refreshments included. Several tech/business books from our Promenade Speakers and Focal Press Sponsors plus one pre-order of The Age of Em will be given away at random. 

Lead Sponsor:  Promenade Speakers Bureau

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
Happy New Year Ladies!

Are you looking to take the Security+ exam?

Let's study together!

This is a peer to peer, study session, with Q&A using authorized CompTIA Study Guides to assist attendees in preparation for the SY0-401 exam.

COST: Free

Location: Remote

TIME: Wednesdays: 7:00-9:00PM EST

Registration: Please register with the Security+ Study Group on WSC's site:


http://womenscyberjutsu.site-ym.com/members/group_select.asp?type=17741

For our online study experience, we use JOIN.ME as the online communication tool. For the best JOIN.ME experience please wear a headset with a microphone so that we will all be able to hear each other talk, read aloud and discuss answers. However, if anyone wishes to remain microphone-free, that’s AOK. For first-time users of JOIN.ME, you will have to download the JOIN.ME desktop client first - if you don't already have it - and you will be prompted to download it when you click on the above link. Just follow the online instructions.

If you have any questions please contact me at: [masked].

Give your Info Sec Career the boost it needs for 2016!

See you Wednesday!

Pamela Dean

==================================
The Six Core Books of Knowledge for the SEC+ Exam:

1.0 Network Security 20%

2.0 Compliance and Operational Security 18%

3.0 Threats and Vulnerabilities 20%

4.0 Application, Data and Host Security 15%

5.0 Access Control and Identity Management 15%

6.0 Cryptography 12%
results.name: [Study Group] Security+ SY0-401 - 7:00PM - 9:00PM EST

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.
results.name: Seance in The City Meetup

results.description:
Wednesdays, 7-8:30pm
1/6 - 2/10/16 

This six-week course, taught by IDP’s Executive Director, Kimberly Brown, combines western psychological techniques with traditional practices and instructions to develop our limitless capacity for beneficial and wise action. 

Though we often regard love and compassion as limited qualities, of which we hardly have enough to extend to ourselves and our families, these states can be developed and expanded with practice and effort. In fact, each of us has a boundless capacity for kindness and understanding, which we can apply to all of our relationships -- to ourselves, our family and friends, people we don’t know, and even those we don’t like. 

With this unique offering, we’ll challenge our preconceptions about our limitations, learn to use gentleness to become aware of inherent biases, understand obstacles of guilt and shame, and uncover our true nature of lovingness and receptivity. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2016/01/06/creating-compassionate-world-nyc-online for details and registration. Please note that this space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be accessed by climbing two steep flights of stairs.
results.name: Creating a Compassionate World (Paid)

results.description:

If you are looking to introduce meditation in your life or meditate with a group, join us for this free one hour session. You will get to learn how you can be happy and peaceful through breath & meditation.


The workshop also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited power and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life.


Start your new year on a positive note. Join us for meditation!


More @ Behappymc.org

results.description:
A hacknight with a New Years twist!

The New Year is a great time to take a moment to reflect on your accomplishments and make goals for going forward. Really, we can do this anytime, but it's nice to have a prescribed moment for it.

As a group of awesome coders, let's take this sliver of time to share our goals and support each other in achieving them! Whether it be learning a new language, starting a project you've always dreamed about, launching a project that's been in the works, contributing to open source, or fine tuning an existing project of yours... all goals are perfect.

See you there for an evening of coding, story sharing, and snacks!

* Women only. If you consider yourself to be a woman, we do too. 
* No recruiters.
results.name: Hacky New Year!

// Book 
Stranger in a Strange Land, Robert A. Heinlein 
This is the story of Valentine Michael Smith, born during, and the only survivor of, the first manned mission to Mars. Michael is raised by Martians, and he arrives on Earth as a true innocent: he has never seen a woman and has no knowledge of Earth's cultures or religions. But he brings turmoil with him, as he is the legal heir to an enormous financial empire, not to mention de facto owner of the planet Mars. Michael explores human morality and the meanings of love. He founds his own church, preaching free love and disseminating the psychic talents taught him by the Martians. 

// Location
The Ship, 158 Lafayette St.
Join us at this nautical themed cocktail bar in Soho. 
Cocktails $14 / Wine $12 / Beer $8

// Dues 

This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway! (I also accept Venmo!) 

// Next Month
Join us next month for a month of LOVE. Vote here for your choice.

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Live Model Drawing - Union Square

results.description:
Algorithms are everywhere. From taking an elevator to your office to making music, we use algorithms every day to solve problems. Developers routinely use algorithms to solve programming issues such as:

How will I keep this credit card information secure when I send it?

How can I store this data so I can retrieve it quickly?

How do I make this file smaller so it is easier to share?

In this workshop, we will discuss what an algorithm is, introduce the idea of algorithmic complexity (big O notation), demonstrate sort and search algorithms (with a hands-on demonstrations), and finish with an overview of the many types of algorithms out there.

As a prerequisite, you should have basic familiarity with a programming language (like by having attended our intro to JavaScript workshop or know a back-end language). Not sure if you qualify? <a>Email us.</a>

If you'd like to attend but cannot afford the cost, please request a GDI scholarship.


About your instructor: 

Steph Zhang is a developer at BuzzFeed.
results.name: Intro to Algorithms

results.description:
A PRESENTATION BY THE NASSAU COUNTY FEDERATION OF REPUBLICAN WOMEN

Come hear Phil Haney speak on January 6, 2016 about his efforts to expose terrorist within the United States, and how his initiative was eventually shut down by administration officials.

A founding member of Department of Homeland Security, Phil Haney, began profiling individuals with links to Pakistani extremist groups in the early 2000s. This work grew into his intimate and detailed knowledge of a web of terrorist training efforts as well as the existence of some of the most hateful and extremist mosques in existence.

Because of his research and extensive insight into worldwide terrorist initiatives,

Phil Haney was able to compile an extensive database of information on terrorists and their worldwide efforts. He is personally responsible for identifying more than 300 suspected terrorists.

On January 6, Phil will explain how his efforts could potentially have prevented the San Bernardino attacks had he been allowed to continue his work. We will discuss how we can potentially harness his body of work to protect America moving forward. This is a presentation you do not want to miss.

You must RSVP to reserve a seat. Either email Rosemary Serra at [masked] or call her at:[masked]

Our Distinguished Host for the Evening:
results.name: "THE TRUTH" with PHIL HANEY, THE WHISTLEBLOWER

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
